DistributionChannel.Description: Client : désigne l’acheteur d’un TAB-SMS par envoi d’une demande de titre de transport au numéro court 93100 ou 93800 par SMS depuis son téléphone mobile, ou l’utilisateur d’un TAB-SMS qui lui est propre obtenu par le téléphone d’un autre usager avec lequel il voyage conjointement ;

SalesOfferPackage.Name: t+ ticket - paper
SalesOfferPackage.Description: Must reside or work in Paris area to get a Navigo residents card

UserProfile.Name: Must reside or work in Isle de France area

DistributionAssignment.Name: Online
DistributionAssignment.Description: The Navigo Travel Card can be obtained: online from the "Order a Navigo card" section. You will need a photo to upload or take a photo during the online ordering process. You can have it posted to you

DistributionAssignment.Name: Online
DistributionAssignment.Description: The Navigo Travel Card can be obtained: online from the "Order a Navigo card" section. You will need a photo to upload or take a photo during the online ordering process. You can collect it from a ticket office

DistributionAssignment.Name: ticket office
DistributionAssignment.Description: The Navigo Travel Card can be obtained:at any time in a ticket or sales office. You will need proof of identity and proof of residence). The photo will be taken by staff;

DistributionAssignment.Name: ticket office
DistributionAssignment.Description: The Navigo Travel Card can be obtained: - by post with the Agence Navigo by sending a completed Navigo Travel Card application form (available at Navigo sales offices, ticket offices or customer service offices.

DistributionAssignment.Name: ticket office
DistributionAssignment.Description: Go to a ticket office to get your Navigo Easy Travel Card.

FareFrame.Name: Paris example - t+ flat fare product

GeographicalUnit.Name: Noctilien Unit Zone
GeographicalUnit.Description: Noctilien trips are priced in terms of unit zones with the same price as a t+ trip

Tariff.Name: t+

TimeInterval.Name: Bus / Tram Duration
TimeInterval.Description: SMS bus ticket buys a single 60 minute ride

TimeInterval.Name: Bus / Tram Trip Duration
TimeInterval.Description: In the bus network, tickets are valid for 90 minutes between the first and last validation, including one or several transfers. T+ tickets must be validated each time you board a bus or tram. With a smart card or mobile app ticket In the metro and RER, tickets are valid for 90 minutes for a single, one-way trip, which might include transfers. It cannot be used for several different trips within this time period.

TimeInterval.Name: Metro / RER Trip Duration
TimeInterval.Description: With a paper ticket In the metro and RER, tickets are valid for two hours for a single, one-way trip, which might include transfers. It cannot be used for several different trips within this time period.

FareStructureElement.Name: Access rights Bus Tram
FareStructureElement.Description: Bus/Tram can be used for 90 minutes (between first and last validation), OR the Metro/RER can be used for 90 minutes [eticket] / 120 minutes [paper ticket] (you need to exit the network before 90 minutes after the first validation)

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Can use Metro and local train (RER) and connect from one to the other
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: In the metro and RER, tickets are valid for 90 minute on eticket or 120 mins paper ticket for a single, one-way trip, which might include transfers. It cannot be used for several different trips within this time period.

UsageValidityPeriod.Description: Metro - Metro for 90 minutes hours from validation; Metro - RER and RER - RER within Paris, for 90 minutes hours between the first and last validation;

Interchanging.Description: Return trips or a break in your journey on the same bus or tram route are not allowed with the same Ticket t+.

GenericParameterAssignment.Description: Valid for RER central zone only

In the bus network, tickets are valid for 90 minutes between the first and last validation, including one or several transfers. T+ tickets must be validated each time you board a bus or tram.
See https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/en/tickets-fares/detail/ticket-t A single Ticket t+ is valid from end to end of a bus route (with the exception of certain regular routes, see below). You can connect between bus and tram for 90 minutes between the first and last validation. Please note: the t+ ticket is not accepted on express trams Return trips or a break in your journey on the same bus or tram route are not allowed with the same Ticket t+.

Interchanging.Description: Return trips or a break in your journey on the same bus or tram route are not allowed with the same Ticket t+.

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Excluded lines
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: Please note: the t+ ticket is not accepted on express trams

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Can make a single funicular ride
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: A Ticket t+ can be used for a single trip. (The Ticket t+ does not allow for a free interchange between the Métro or bus network and the funicular.)

FareStructureElement.Name: Eligibility
FareStructureElement.Description: ? Children under age 4 can travel free throughout the metro, RER, bus, and tramway networks, provided they do not occupy a seat. ? Children under 10 can travel with reduced fare tickets: 50% discount on packs of 10 t+ tickets loaded on your Navigo Easy pass/smartphone and 50% discount on origin/destination tickets (single tickets or ticket packs)

CompanionProfile.Name: Babe in arms must be with adult

UserProfile.Name: Veteran
UserProfile.Description: Disabled veterans with a priority card issued by the prefecture of police or a disability card issued by the National Office for Veterans and War Victims, with a single or double blue or red bar, presented alone;

UserProfile.Name: Registered disabled
UserProfile.Description: Blind civilians with a “social assistance for the blind and severely disabled” disability card certified “blind”, together with a travel coupon for the guide;

Refunding.Name: NoRefund
Refunding.Description: Public transport regulations for the Ile-de-France region do not provide for the reimbursement of unused or partially used transportation tickets (purchased individually or in packages of 10)..

Tariff.Name: Noctilien - Night bus tariff
Tariff.Description: See https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/en/tickets-fares/detail/ticket-t Ticket t+ des lignes Noctilien, sur lesquelles les correspondances sont interdites, que le voyageur peut utiliser en validant un ticket t+ pour deux zones carte orange et un ticket t+ par zone supplementaire ; par exception, pour les trajets banlieue-banlieue via Paris, le nombre de ticket t+ est egal au nombre de zones traversees sans les compter deux fois

GeographicalInterval.Name: Noctilien Unit Zone
GeographicalInterval.Description: Noctilien trips are priced in terms of unit zones with the same price as a t+ trip

GeographicalStructureFactor.Name: Noctilien Unit Zone - normal
GeographicalStructureFactor.Description: prices are priced in terms of unit zones with the same price as t+ trip

GeographicalStructureFactor.Name: Noctilien Unit Zone - Double rate
GeographicalStructureFactor.Description: Noctilien trips are priced in terms of unit zones with the same price as a t+ trip

FareStructureElement.Name: Access rights
FareStructureElement.Description: One ticket for travel between the first two zones, and then one ticket for each zone crossed thereafter. Example: zones 1-2 = 1 ticket; zones 1-3 = 2 tickets. Each time you change buses, you must validate a new ticket. The t+ ticket is not valid for transfers between Noctilien night buses.

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: t+ noctilien uses a unit zone interval consumption
Noctilien line - normal
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: Regular lines charge 1 unit per zone

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Noctilien line - double
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: Some lines charge 2 unit per zone

FareStructureElement.Name: Special prices for sms for certain noctilien lines
FareStructureElement.Description: Special prices for sms for certain noctilien lines

ValidableElement.Name: Unlimited rides available for specified duration

GenericParameterAssignment.Description: Time limit on travel for metro rer - 120 mins for eticket
Time limit on travel for bus tram - 90 mins for eticket

SalesOfferPackage.Name: t+ ticket - paper, bus/tram purchased onboard

Interchanging.Description: Return trips or a break in your journey on the same bus or tram route are not allowed with the same Ticket t+.

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Requires a supporting smart card to run on

Notice.Name: Mobile operators supported
Notice.Text:
This service is only available to customers of Bouygues Télécom, Orange, SFR or Free (this excludes limited plans).
The SMS ticket is not available to customers: using virtual mobile network operators. These include Bell, La Poste Mobile, CIC Mobile, Auchan Telecom, NRJ Mobile, Crédit Mutuel Mobile, etc. most business phone plans (check with your employer); non-French phone operators. €2.50 plus the possible cost of sending the SMS for mobile plans that do not include unlimited SMS messages (or any SMS cost the phone operator may apply). The ticket is valid for one hour, no connections with other services are permitted.
The price of the ticket will appear on your phone bill. This service is available via Bouygues, Orange, SFR and Free phone operators. In you are using a prepaid phone card, the price of the SMS ticket is taken from the remaining balance.
You can only buy one ticket for each SMS sent.

Notice.Name: Conditions
Notice.Text: The ticket is valid for one hour, no connections with other services are permitted. The price of the ticket will appear on your phone bill. You can only buy one ticket for each SMS sent.

FareFrame.Name: Paris example - t+ flat carnet of 10

FareStructureElement.Name: Eligibility
FareStructureElement.Description: ? Children under age 4 can travel free throughout the metro, RER, bus, and tramway networks, provided they do not occupy a seat. ? Children under 10 can travel with reduced fare tickets: 50% discount on packs of 10 t+ tickets loaded on your Navigo Easy pass/smartphone and 50% discount on origin/destination tickets (single tickets or ticket packs)

GroupTicket.Name: Primary School party
GroupTicket.Description: Groups of at least 8 children and their accompanying adult traveling on school outings or extracurricular trips organized by primary schools or recreation centers hosted by these institutions. The accompanying adult must fill in a declaration on honor.

Refunding.Name: NoRefund
Refunding.Description: Public transport regulations for the Ile-de-France region do not provide for the reimbursement of unused or partially used transportation tickets (purchased individually or in packages of 10)..

FareFrame.Name: Prices for fare example, using nested fare tables and specific fare price types
FareFrame.Description: Here we use absolute prices. We include examples of how a justification of the derivation can be optionally included as RUKE STEP RESULTs. DISCOUNTING RULE Concessionary fare = (Adult Fare * 50%) DISCOUNTING RULE Onboard fare = (x + onboard Fee) DISCOUNTING RULE Sms fare = (x + SMS Fee)

DiscountingRule.Name: Concessionary discount rate for chidren etc is 50%
Onboard purchase fee
DiscountingRule.Description: Negative discount - charge 0.35 EUR for onboard purchase

DiscountingRule.Name: SMS fee
DiscountingRule.Description: Negative discount - charge 0.35 EUR for sms delivery

FareStructureElementPrice.Name: t+ Noctilien 1 zone price normal
FareStructureElementPrice.Description: One ticket for travel between the first two zones, and then one ticket for each zone crossed thereafter. Example: zones 1-2 = 1 ticket; zones 1-3 = 2 tickets.Prices is same as t+ adult

FareStructureElementPrice.Name: t+ Noctilien 1 zone price double
FareStructureElementPrice.Description: Two tickets for travel between the first two zones, and then two tickets for each zone crossed thereafter. Example: zones 1-2 = 2 ticket; zones 1-3 = 4 tickets.Prices is same as 2 x t+ adult

FareStructureElementPrice.Name: t+ single trip Adult sms ticket - special night price
FareStructureElementPrice.Description: Hack to allow special prices without creating a separate sales package

QualityStructureFactorPrice.Name: t+ single trip Adult sms carnet of 10
t+ single trip Concessionary fare sms carnet of 10

RuleStepResult.Narrative: Concessionary carnet is half adult carnet, rounded down to the nearest 5 cents.
